channel_description: Groudon, Kyogre, the Grand Festival, the Hoenn League—what DOESN’T Ash deal with in the eighth season of Pokémon the Series? See it now on Pokémon TV!

media.description: The kids are heading to Maisie Island on a ferry when they spot a Spoink floating on a log. They quickly realize it's the same Spoink they helped before.
media.title: Clamperl of Wisdom

media.description: The kids are relaxing at the Grand Wazoo Resort on Wazoo Island when a man emerges from the water completely covered in seaweed.
media.title: The Relicanth Really Can

media.description: En route to the ABC Islands, Ash and the gang are passed on the way to Island A by a group of children racing on top Huntail or Gorebyss.
media.title: The Evolutionary War

media.description: The kids land on Muscle Island, where another ferry will finally take them to Mossdeep City. Team Rocket also lands on the island, fleeing their sub because they think it will explode.
media.title: Training Wrecks

media.description: The kids are floating on logs at sea when a red submarine appears beneath them, belonging to Team Magma.
media.title: Gaining Groudon

media.description: Team Magma and Team Aqua continue to fight on Monsu Island. The Red Orb, which can control Kyogre, is currently held by the Team Aqua Leader Archie.
media.title: The Scuffle of Legends

media.description: Ash and friends finally arrive in Mossdeep City and head straight to the Pokémon Gym—only to find it empty because everyone in town is at the Space Center for the shuttle launch.
media.title: It's Still Rocket Roll to Me

media.description: Ash's battle with the Mossdeep Gym Leaders is set to begin. He calls out Swellow and Pikachu versus Tate's Solrock and Liza's Lunatone, taking into account the strange planet-filled aerial battlefield they will be using.
media.title: Solid as a Solrock

media.description: Ash is battling with another Trainer by the waterfront, not realizing he is being watched by a mysterious sailor.
media.title: Vanity Affair

media.description: The kids travel to Wales Island, where both Ash and May have plans to train. May is thrilled when her Bulbasaur learns a new attack.
media.title: Where's Armaldo?

media.description: The kids are still headed for Izabe Island, where May will compete in her next Pokémon Contest with Bulbasaur.
media.title: A Cacturne for the Worse

media.description: Ash and friends continue their journey across Izabe Island, where they spot a giant stone Poké Ball atop a cliff. They meet a sage named Sigourney, who tells them the story of the giant ball.
media.title: Claydol Big and Tall

media.description: Ash and Brock face off for a friendly training battle. Ash pits his Torkoal against Brock's Lombre, which it seems like a mismatch until Torkoal lets loose with Overheat.
media.title: Once in a Mawile

media.description: Lost in a desert, Ash and his friends see lots of identical pits in the ground—Trapinch burrows! A young woman named Elisa warns them they're trespassing on hazardous territory.
media.title: Beg, Burrow, and Steal

media.description: Ash is approaching the next town on Izabe Island when a sudden surge in the river destroys the bridge he was about to cross. An Absol is spotted in the wreckage, and the locals arrive to capture it.
media.title: Absol-ute Disaster

media.description: In a snowy region of Izabe Island, Ash and his friends take a rest at a Pokémon Center. As they're greeted by Nurse Joy, a Snorunt steals Ash's badges right out of his backpack!
media.title: Let It Snow, Let It Snow, Let It Snorunt!

media.description: As Ash and his friends are taking a break, Max hears a cry for help and finds a sick Ralts. It's too weak to walk but needs to be treated at a Pokémon Center.
media.title: Do I Hear a Ralts?

media.description: Our heroes have arrived in Sootopolis at last, and Ash is ready to earn his eighth badge—but first it's time to watch the Sootopolis Gym Leader, Juan, put on an impressive water show!
media.title: The Great Eight Fate

media.description: Team Rocket has dressed James up as Juan to attract an audience for their Water Illusion show, but back at the Gym, it's a tense back and forth as Corphish confronts Luvdisc.
media.title: Eight Ain't Enough

media.description: Ash is now three months away from Ever Grande City and the Hoenn League, while May is gearing up for her next contest in. But after they stop for a rest, two of May's Poké Balls suddenly vanish!
media.title: Showdown at Linoone

media.description: When Ash and May see Drew training his Masquerain, May can't resist the challenge of a practice match.
media.title: Who, What, When, Where, Wynaut?

media.description: May and her friends are headed to Pacifidlog Island for the last Pokémon Contest before the Grand Festival. But their boat has engine trouble and the pilot, Carlos, lands on a nearby island.
media.title: Date Expectations

media.description: May is practicing for her contest, and Ash wants Snorunt to practice Ice Beam. But Snorunt's wild aim hits Team Rocket instead and scares another Coordinator's Aipom.
media.title: Mean With Envy

media.description: The second round of the Pacifidlog Contest begins! Erica and her Jynx face a suspiciously familiar team—the Jester and Meowth.
media.title: Pacifidlog Jam

media.description: The kids reach a Pokémon Center and Ash goes off to practice Ice Beam with Snorunt, while May goes off to make PokéBlock.
media.title: Berry, Berry Interesting

media.description: Our friends have stopped to eat, but Munchlax won't stop eating! Ash is training when he sees a sandwich come rolling down a hill, and Munchlax gulps down the sandwich.
media.title: Less Is Morrison

media.description: Officer Jenny reveals that even though Team Magma and Team Aqua have disbanded, a former Team Magma member—Brodie the Phantom Thief—is onboard and intent on stealing valuables.
media.title: The Ribbon Cup Caper

media.description: May has arrived in Slateport City for the Grand Festival. Her mother, Caroline, has come to cheer her on, and her friends sent notes to wish her luck.
media.title: Hi Ho Silver Wind

media.description: The Grand Festival is underway in Slateport. Harley asks May if they can train together for the main competition.
media.title: Deceit and Assist

media.description: May and Harley face off in the main competition of the Grand Festival! It's Harley's Banette and Cacturne against May's Beautifly and Bulbasaur. May's team gets in the first hits, but Harley makes a comeback.
media.title: Rhapsody in Drew

media.description: Ash is ready to board the ferry to Ever Grande City when May comes running up—she's won four plane tickets to Ever Grande!
media.title: Island Time

media.description: Ash and his friends have finally arrived in Ever Grande city for the Hoenn League Championships, but they're mobbed by a group of Murkrow as they're looking for a place to eat.
media.title: Like a Meowth to Flame

media.description: Where's Morrison? That's the question on Ash's mind as he trains his Pokémon in preparation for the big tournament in Ever Grande City.
media.title: Saved by the Beldum

media.description: The preliminaries are over, and now the Hoenn League Championships begin in earnest! The qualifying round is all double battles, and Ash goes to watch Morrison's match against muscleman Gavin.
media.title: From Brags to Riches

media.description: Ash, Tyson, and Morrison are all aiming for the top of the Hoenn League, but first they have to qualify for the Victory Tournament stage of the competition.
media.title: Shocks and Bonds

media.description: The first round of the Victory Tournament finds Ash in a tight spot. He has three Pokémon remaining; Katie, his opponent, has four.
media.title: A Judgment Brawl

media.description: Morrison and Ash are battling each other in the Hoenn League, and Morrison is so upset he can't bring himself to choose his next Pokémon after his Girafarig is knocked out!
media.title: Choose It or Lose It

media.description: It's the battle between Ash and Tyson to decide who moves on to the final four of the Hoenn League, and Glalie and Sceptile are already out!
media.title: At the End of the Fray

media.description: Tyson and Morrison are off to new adventures; May and Max return to Petalburg while Ash and Brock head back to Kanto. Even Team Rocket goes back to headquarters and reports to a thoroughly unimpressed Giovanni.
media.title: The Scheme Team

media.description: Ash has returned to Pallet Town to find a reunion of friends! May stops by Ash's house but Ash has left for Professor Oak's lab.
media.title: The Right Place and the Right Mime

media.description: Ash and his friends are on their way to the Battle Frontier, and Misty joins them for a while as she heads back to Cerulean City.
media.title: A Real Cleffa-Hanger

media.description: The Battle Factory is Ash's next destination—if he can find it, that is. He and his friends have become lost, but they see snow and an Articuno flying overhead, followed by a plane in distress.
media.title: Numero Uno Articuno

media.description: Ash has opted to battle Articuno with Charizard in his Battle Factory match. Now he's busy training with Charizard, who has gotten even stronger during its time in the Charicific Valley.
media.title: The Symbol Life

media.description: Ash's Battle Factory victory has him eager to reach the next Battle Frontier stop right away, but even he has to stop for food and water.
media.title: Hooked on Onix

media.description: On their way to the Battle Arena, Ash and his friends are snagged by a net trap. But for once, it's not Team Rocket—it's a fellow named Mitch and his Loudred.
media.title: Rough, Tough Jigglypuff

media.description: May and Ash are waiting on line outside a popular bakery when an Arcanine runs past. May wants to catch it, but she sees that Drew is chasing it too!
media.title: On Cloud Arcanine

media.description: A Psyduck is frantically running from a Machop, Machoke, and Machamp when it hurls headlong into Ash and friends, on their way to the Pokémon Contest in Saffron City.
media.title: Sitting Psyduck

media.description: Chasing after a hungry Munchlax, Ash and his friends end up at Rhonda's, a restaurant run by a girl named Rhonda with Mr. Mime as its head chef.
media.title: Hail to the Chef

media.description: On their way to Saffron City, Ash and his friends encounter a Caterpie and its Trainer-in-training, Xander, who mistakes them for lab robbers.
media.title: Caterpie's Big Dilemma

media.description: May and friends arrive in Saffron City, where May is so excited about the upcoming Pokémon Contest that she heads straight for the Contest Hall.
media.title: The Saffron Con

media.description: The contest in Saffron City is about to begin! A disguised Jessie comes up to the stage, impressing and horrifying the crowd when she embraces James' Cacnea.
media.title: A Hurdle for Squirtle

media.description: May and Brock want to try some awesome noodles. Ash and Max want to check out a Fighting-type Pokémon dojo. Unable to fully agree, the two groups split up.
media.title: Pasta la Vista
